revised_title: Embryogeny and Development of Comatula Rosacea
tldr: The author, Wyville Thomson, describes the embryogeny and development of Comatula Rosacea, a type of crinoid. He explains the process of impregnation, segmentation, and the formation of the larva. He also discusses the differentiation of internal organs and the development of the echinoderm-zooid. The author notes that further observations are needed to understand the development process more clearly.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology > Echinodermatology
